column4: seq: I have installed latest versions and I have checked /var/log/apache2/error.log...
seq: dunno, i dont know all my config settings by heart...
what is the error you get on POST verb?
there are no messages at all. Page just refreshes. I have tried login forms and search forms that used to work just fine.
are you checking the access log?
it says 200 returned. are they php pages that are blank? can you resolve a simple info.php file?

pages arent blank. When I click any of the submit buttons, then the current page just refreshes and nothing happens. I just tried a test php file with a minimal form. The value does not submit and print_r($_POST)=Array ( )
can you resolve an info.php file?
not quite sure what you mean
create a file called php under your web root where it will be accessible and put '<?php phpinfo(); ?>' (without qoutes) save it as info.php and open it in the browser - what occurs?
phpinfo occurs. What should I look for?
ok || try to turn on php error logging and check your apache configuration then
from php.ini: error_reporting  =  E_ALL & ~E_NOTICE, display_errors = On. I just discovered this only happens for php files that are within one of my project dirs!
f.ex. when I move the test.php to a different dir (project), it works fine
